intro: Pentaraphia tenera, commonly known as the slender strobilanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
